member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.AlienDataDirector
member.summary: EXPERIMENTAL. Objects of this class may be used for sending Alien reader's messages to an external listener. Typical use of this class is by a mobile device, which is listening for Alien reader's notifications using CAlienServer objects and wants to transfer those to a host (target) computer.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienDataDirector.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Net.IPAddress,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates instance for connecting to specified host server.
member.param: Network port value for connecting to host (target.)
IPAddress value for connecting to host (target.)
TRUE for turning internal API logging ON, FALSE otherwise.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienDataDirector.Finalize
member.summary: Disconnects and destroys current instance with freing any resources.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienDataDirector.Disconnect
member.summary: Closes previously opened network connection to host and frees network resources.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienDataDirector.ConnectToHost
member.summary: Opens network connection to host and starts transferring Alien readers' messages from all instances of the CAlienServer class that has been added with the AddServer() method.

member.summary: Adds new reference of an existing instance of class CAlienServer to the internal collection of the AlienDataDirector.
member.param: An existing instance of the class CAlienServer

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienDataDirector.RemoveServer(System.String)
member.summary: Removes specified server reference from current servers' connections.
member.param: String specifying which collection member to remove from the internal collection of current instance.

member.summary: Returns TRUE if current instance contains server specified by this connection info, FALSE otherwise.
member.param: String as returned by the CAlienServer.NotificationHost property.
member.returns: TRUE if current instance contains specified server, FALSE otherwiese.

member.summary: Event raised by an object of the AlienDataDirector class in case if an Alien reader's msg has been successfully transferred to a host.

member.summary: Event raised by an object of the AlienDataDirector class in case if an Alien reader's msg has been received but could not be transferred to a host due to an error.

member.summary: Parses a Tag List string that is either in Text or XML format as returned by the "Get TagList" command into an array of type TagInfo.

'Out' parameter - Array of type TagInfo.

member.summary: Parses a Tag List string (in Text format) returned by the "Get TagList" command into array of variables of type TagInfo.
member.param: Input string containing tag list data. Must be in the Text format as defined in the Alien Reader Interface Guide. Otherwise an exception will be generated.
'Out' parameter - Array of type TagInfo.
member.returns: Number of tags in the tag list.
member.remarks: This method throws exceptions.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienUtils.ParseXMLTagList(System.String,nsAlienRFID2.TagInfo[]@)
member.summary: Parses an Alien Tag List string (in XML format) returned by the "Get TagList" command into an array of variables of type TagInfo.
member.param: Input string containing tag list data in the XML format.
'Out' parameter - Array of type TagInfo.
member.returns: Number of tags in the Tag List.
member.remarks: This method throws exceptions for a bad XML format.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienUtils.ParseNotification(System.String,nsAlienRFID2.NotifyInfo@)
member.summary: Parses an Alien reader Notification string either in the Text or in the XML format into an object of type NotifyInfo containing an array of type TagInfo.
member.param: Input string containing Notification data. Must be either in the Text or XML format as defined in the Alien Reader Interface Guide. Otherwise an exception will be generated.
'Out' parameter - an object of type NotifyInfo filled with the information available in the Notification message.
member.returns: Number of tags in the Tag list contained within the Notification message.
member.remarks: This method throws exceptions.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienUtils.ParseTextNotification(System.String,nsAlienRFID2.NotifyInfo@)
member.summary: Parses an Alien reader Notification string (in Text format) into an object of type ReaderInfo and an array of variables of type TagInfo.
member.param: Input string containing Notification data. Must be in the Text format and have a NotifyHeader as defined in the Alien Reader Interface Guilde. Otherwise an exception will be generated.
'Out' parameter - an object of type NotifyInfo filled with the information available in the Notification message.
member.returns: Number of tags in the Tag list contained within the Notification message.
member.remarks: This method throws exceptions.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienUtils.ParseXMLNotification(System.String,nsAlienRFID2.NotifyInfo@)
member.summary: Parses an Alien reader Notification string (in the XML format) into an object of type ReaderInfo and an array of variables of type TagInfo.
member.param: Input string containing Notification data. Must be in the XML format as defined in the Alien Reader Interface Guilde. Otherwise an exception will be generated.
'Out' parameter - an object of type NotifyInfo filled with the information available in the Notification message.
member.returns: Number of tags in the Tag list contained within the Notification message.
member.remarks: This method throws exceptions.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienUtils.ParseReaderState(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string of Alien Reader settings into Hashtable.
member.param: String as returned by Alien Reader "Info" command.
member.returns: Hashtable where every setting is represented by a key (a trimmed string prior to the "=" sign in the Alien Reader Current Settings) and a value (a trimmed string in Current Settings following the "=" sign.)

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienUtils.ParseReaderState(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a string of Alien Reader settings into a Hashtable where key values don't contain any help information of reader settings.
member.param: String as returned by Alien Reader "Info" command.

If true then this method will remove any help information from the left-site values of reader's settings prior to filling them into resulting Hashtable as key values (e.g.: the setting "AutoMode (On or Off)" will result in the key "AutoMode")
member.returns: Hashtable where every setting is represented by a key (a trimmed string prior to the "=" sign in the Alien Reader Current Settings) and a value (a trimmed string in Current Settings following the "=" sign.)

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.AlienLog
member.summary: Troubleshooting helper static class that allows writing messages to the 'AlienAPI.log' file. File gets open, appended, and closed for every single writing operation. Default Path is the Alien domain within BizTalk RFID: "C:\Program Files\Microsoft BizTalk RFID\Providers\Alien\." Rollover size is 1MB with renaming an older file by adding a time stamp. All AlienAPI*.log files with the LastAccessTime older than 24 hours get deleted during rollovers.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AlienLog.WriteLine(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Writes specified line of text to the AlienAPI.log file.
member.param: TRUE to enable writing.
String of text to log.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.AlienLog.Path
member.summary: Get/Set full path (without file name) to write the AlienAPI*.log files to. If not set explicitely the default value will be for full API: @"C:\Program Files\Microsoft BizTalk RFID\Providers\Alien\" or the executing assembly CodeBase path for mobile API. Should be set just once prior using AlienLog writing methods.

member.param: Must contain at least one item in the format: [name] value. Multiple items must be separated by the '|' characters.
member.returns: An object of class MyData as a "string, string" Dictionary or NULL if input string was null.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.SendReceive(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Virtual method for synchronous communication with an Alien Reader when implemented in a derived class.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.param: String representing command to an Alien Reader.
True if caller expects the reader appends the command line prompt (for example "Alien>") to the response to command.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.Reboot
member.summary:
Reboots the reader. This commands takes several seconds to complete and causes a series of reader responses sent back to the caller. Reader terminates network connection before reboot is complete. In case of serial connection, Reader is rebooted after the last message sent: "Boot> Ready"
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.returns: In case of serial connection, string representing complete rebooting sequence or a part of it prior network disconnecting otherwise.
member.NOTE: During the reboot reader closes TCP connection with the host. In case of network connection, caller won't be able to receive complete reboot sequence.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.WakeTag
member.summary:
Sends Gen2 "Select" command to all or to a subset of tags in the field (subject to "Mask" settings)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.returns: String "OK" on success

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.WakeTag(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends Gen2 "Select" command to all or to a subset of tags in the field (subject to "Mask" settings)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.param: Number of selects to issue.
member.returns: String "OK" on success

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.SleepTag
member.summary:
Sends "Sleep" command to all or to a subset of tags in the field (subject to "Mask" command)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.returns: String "OK".

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.ProgramTag(System.String)
member.summary:
Attempts to program and verify a tag in the field with the specified ID
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.param: String containing a list of Hexadecimal bytes separated by spaces For example: "80 00 FF EE 10 00 00 01"
member.returns: On success string "Success!" or string with just programmed ID depending on setting of the ProgSuccessFormat property.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.VerifyTag
member.summary:
Obtains the complete tag memory without validating the tag ID against the checksum.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.returns: String containing: In case of a not locked tag - 2 bytes of checksum, at least 8 bytes of tag ID, and 2 bytes of Lock and Pass-code In case of a locked tag - "Programmed Tag. (Locked)"

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.EraseTag
member.summary:
Sets entire EPC memory of a tag to zeros. This command doesn't affect other Gen2 memory banks.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.returns: "Success!" on success.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.G2Erase(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a specified portion of Gen2 tag memory to zeros.
member.param: Gen2 memory bank. Valid values: 0...3.
Starting memory position. Valid values: 0...2097151.
Number of words to erase. Valid values: 0...32.

Locks a tag for unauthorized memory changes.

member.param: A Hexadecimal string representing byte value of the Lock- and Pass-code
member.returns: "Success!" on success

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.LockUserBlocks(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Permanently locks specified user memory of a Gen2 tag.
member.param: Decimal block pointer.
Hex byte specifying first bitmask of desired "permalock" states.
Hex byte specifying second bitmask of desired "permalock" states.
member.returns: "Success!" on success

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.HideAlienUserBlocks(System.String)
member.summary: Makes specified memory blocks readable only with an Access password. Note: this "read locks" are enforced only if the tag has a non-zero password.
member.param: Bitmask as a hex byte string specifying wich memory blocks are readable and wich aren't.
member.returns: "Success!" on success

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.KillTag(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Renders a Gen2 tag permanently inoperative. For a Class1-Gen1 tag - initializes the memory of a locked tag to all zeros.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.param: Full tag ID as a Hexadecimal string
Hexadecimal string representing KillCode.
member.returns: "Success!" on success

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.SetAcqMask(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method is an overload for the Mask Set property.
member.param: String representing decimal number as mask length in bits.
String representing decimal number as bit pointer specifying where to apply mask.
Hexadecimal string representing mask bytes.

example.code: mReader.SetAcqMask("1", "0", "0"); // Clear mask allowing all tags to be addressed.
mReader.SetAcqMask("16", "0", "00 03"); //Set mask matching 16 bits starting from bit0 to '00 03'

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.SetAcqC1Mask(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method is an overload for AcqC1Mask Set property.
member.param: String representing decimal number as bit pointer specifying where to apply mask.
String representing decimal number as mask length in bits.
Hexadecimal string representing mask bytes.
member.remarks: The 'AcqC1Mask' is exclusive of the 'Mask' and 'AcqG2Mask' properties.

example.code: mReader.SetAcqC1Mask("1", "0", "0"); // Clear mask allowing all tags to be addressed.
mReader.SetAcqC1Mask("0", "16", "00 03"); //Set mask matching 16 bits starting from bit0 to '00 03'

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.SetAcqG2Mask(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method is an overload for the AcqG2Mask Set property.
member.param: String representing decimal number of addressed bank.
String representing decimal number as bit pointer specifying where to apply mask.
String representing decimal number as mask length in bits.
Hexadecimal string representing mask bytes.

example.code: mReader.SetAcqG2Mask("1", "32", "8", "03"); // Set mask for any tag with EPC starting with "03"
mReader.SetAcqG2Mask("2", "16", "8", "34"); // Set mask for only Alien tags (TID bank, byte#3=0x34)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.Mask
member.summary: Gets / Sets string representing the current tag ID mask that the reader uses. This property reflects both the reader's "Mask" and "AcqMask" commands. This property is different from the AckC1Mask property in the following: it allows masking only on tags ID field and uses the "Len->Ptr->Data" string format instead of "Ptr->Len->Data."
member.remarks: This property is exclusive of the 'AcqC1Mask' and 'AcqG2Mask' properties.

example.code: mReader.Mask = "0"; // Clear mask allowing all tags to be addressed.
mReader.Mask = "16, 0, 00 03"; //setting mask to match 16 bits starting from bit0 to '00 03'

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.AcqC1Mask
member.summary: Gets / Sets string representing current mask for the tag EPC field. This property is different from the Mask property in the following: it allows masking on the CRC field and uses the "Ptr->Len->Data" string format instead of "Len->Ptr->Data."
member.remarks: This property is exclusive of the 'Mask' and 'AcqG2Mask' properties.

example.code: mReader.AcqC1Mask = "0"; // Clear mask allowing all tags to be addressed.
mReader.AcqC1Mask = "0, 16, 00 03"; //Set mask matching 16 bits starting from bit0 to '00 03'

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.AcqG2Mask
member.summary: Gets / Sets string representing current mask for any filterable field of a Gen2 tag.

example.code: mReader.AcqG2Mask = "0"; // Clear mask allowing all tags to be addressed.
mReader.AcqG2Mask = "1, 32, 8, 03"; // Set mask for any tag with EPC starting with "03"
mReader.AcqG2Mask = "2, 16, 8, 34"; // Set mask for only Alien tags (TID bank, byte#3=0x34)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.AcqG2MaskAction
member.summary: Specifies wether mask for a Gen2 tag is inclusive (only tags matching mask respond) or exclusive (only tags NOT matching mask respond.) Exclusive masks do not apply to Class1 Gen1 tags. Valid values: "Include", "Exclude." Default value is "Include."

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.ProgReadAttempts
member.summary:
Gets / Sets integer (in decimal format) that defines how many times the reader tries to read a tag in order to verify its presence prior to a programming task. This property is used during the following programming tasks: Program, Erase, Kill, Lock. Any successive attempt of reading tag will abort further attempts. Valid values: 1...255.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.ProgEraseAttempts
member.summary:
Gets / Sets integer (in decimal format) that defines number of erasing attempts the reader makes when requested to erase or program a tag. The ProgEraseAttempts property is used during the following programming tasks: Program, Erase. Any successive attempt of erasing tag will abort further attempts.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.CBaseReader.ProgAttempts
member.summary:
Gets / Sets integer (in decimal format) that defines number of programming attempts the reader makes when requested to program tag. Any successive attempt of programming tag will abort further attempts.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.OpenCOMport(System.String)
member.summary: Opens specified com port without any verification of reader's presence. Sets the IsConnected property. Sets the SerialPort property to specified port name. Sets the ReaderSettings property InterfaceType to ComInterface.enumSerial. Raises the Connected event on success. If this com port was open before calling this method it closes this connection and reopens it again. Throws exceptions.
member.param: String with the desired com port name (e.g.: "COM1".)

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.OpenCOMport(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens specified com port using specified baud rate without any verification of readers' presence. Sets the IsConnected property. Sets the SerialPort property to specified port name. Sets the HostBaudRate property to specified value. Sets the ReaderSettings property InterfaceType to ComInterface.enumSerial. Raises the Connected event on success. If this com port was open before calling this method it closes this connection and reopens it again. Throws exceptions.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Connect
member.summary: Establishes Serial or Telnet connection depending on previously set InterfaceType. Returns synchronously when the operation completed. Upon success raises "Connected" event.
member.returns: On success: "Connected" or "Already connected". Otherwise: "Can't connect", or an Exception message, or a message starting with "Error".

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ConnectEasy
member.summary: Establishes Serial or Telnet connection depending on previously set InterfaceType. In opposite to the OpenCOMport() method, the ConnectEasy() method verifies reader's presence and communication and doesn't close a previously existing connection. In opposite to the Connect() method, the ConnectEasy() method if reader wasn't connected previosly turns the reader's NotifyMode and AutoMode off. Returns synchronously when the operation completed. Upon success raises "Connected" event.
member.returns: On success: "Connected" or "Already connected". Otherwise: "Can't connect", or an Exception message, or a message starting with "Error".

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ConnectAndLogin(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Closes a previously open connection. Sets ComInterface property to enumTCP InterfaceType. Tries to open network connection with specified ipaddress and port number. Upon successful connection raises the Connected event and tries to login with specified username and password. Returns if successfully connected and logged in. Throws exceptions on any failure.
member.param: String of reader's IP Address (in the IPv4 format.)
Integer nuber of eithernet port to use for connection.
Case-sencitive string of reader's username. Default value: "alien"
Case-sencitive string or SecureString of reader's password. Default value: "password"

member.summary:
Attempts to program and verify a tag in the field with the specified ID.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.returns: On success string "Success!" or string with just programmed ID depending on setting of the 'ProgSuccessFormat' reader's property.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgramUser(System.String)
member.summary:
Attempts to program and verify a tag in the field with the specified user data.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.param: String containing a list of Hexadecimal bytes separated by spaces (e.g.: "00 11 22 33 aa bb cc ee".) In case of an empty string or a null parameter, the value specified by the 'ProgUserData' reader's property will be used instead.
member.returns: On success string "Success!" or string with just programmed user data depending on setting of the 'ProgSuccessFormat' reader's property.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgramAndLockEPC(System.String)
member.summary:
Programs specified ID bytes into the EPC bank of a Gen2 tag and locks it with a lock type predefined by setting the 'ProgG2LockType' property.
Since locking without an Access Password doesn't mean anything, the Access Password (given by the 'ProG2AccessPwd' property) is automatically written in this operation as well. When the 'ProgG2LockType' is PermaLock or PermaUnlock, the Access Password is not written, since these lock types already protect the associated memory bank, even without an Access Password present.
You should set the 'AcqG2AccessPwd' to the same value as the 'ProgG2AccessPwd' to facilitate this double operation.
member.param: Hexadecimal string representing ID bytes. In case of an empty string or null parameter, the value specified by the 'ProgEPCData' reader's property will be used instead.
member.returns: String 'Success' or tag Id successfully written to tag (depending on the ProgSuccessFormat' property.)

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgramAndLockUser(System.String)
member.summary:
Programs specified user data into the USER bank of a Gen2 tag and locks it with a lock type predefined by setting the 'ProgG2LockType' property.
Since locking without an Access Password doesn't mean anything, the Access Password (given by the 'ProG2AccessPwd' property) is automatically written in this operation as well. When the 'ProgG2LockType' is PermaLock or PermaUnlock, the Access Password is not written, since these lock types already protect the associated memory bank, even without an Access Password present.
You should set the 'AcqG2AccessPwd' to the same value as the 'ProgG2AccessPwd' to facilitate this double operation.
member.param: Hexadecimal string representing user bytes. In case of an empty string or null parameter, the value specified by the 'ProgUserData' reader's property will be used instead.
member.returns: String 'Success' or tag data successfully written to tag (depending on the ProgSuccessFormat' property.)

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgramKillPwd(System.String)
member.summary: Programs a Gen2 tag's Kill Password.
member.param: String representing Kill Password (four bytes separated by spaces.) If argument is empty string or null, the value specified by the reader's 'ProgG2KillPwd' property is used instead.
member.returns: Status string as defined by the reader's 'ProgSuccessFormat' property.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgramAccessPwd(System.String)
member.summary: Programs a Gen2 tag's Access Password.
member.param: String representing Access Password (four bytes separated by spaces.) If argument is empty string or null, the value specified by the reader's 'ProgG2AccessPwd' property is used instead.
member.returns: Status string as defined by the reader's 'ProgSuccessFormat' property.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Lock(nsAlienRFID2.eLockTarget,System.String)
member.summary:
Locks tag's memory specified by the 'lockTarget' parameter. The type of locking used with Gen2 tags must be predefined by the reader's 'ProgG2LockType' property.
If a Gen2 tag has a non-zero Access Password, you must supply this password for successful operation.
member.param: Specifies lock target as "EPC", "User", "KillPwd", or "AccessPwd" enumeration value.
String representing four bytes of Access Password if required.
member.returns: Status string as defined by the reader's 'ProgSuccessFormat' property.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Unlock(nsAlienRFID2.eLockTarget,System.String)
member.summary:
Unlocks tag's memory specified by the 'lockTarget' parameter. The type of locking used with Gen2 tags must be predefined by the reader's 'ProgG2LockType' property.
If a Gen2 tag has a non-zero Access Password, you must supply this password for successful operation.
member.param: Specifies lock target as "EPC", "User", "KillPwd", or "AccessPwd" enumeration value.
String representing four bytes of Access Password if required.
member.returns: Status string as defined by the reader's 'ProgSuccessFormat' property.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.GetAntennaPower(System.String)
member.summary: Returns integer representing current RF power for a specified antenna as percent of maximum power.
member.param: Name of antenna (e.g.: "0".) If NULL retrieves RF power level on the first antenna.
member.returns: Percent of current RF power.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.SetAntennaPower(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets current RF power to specified percent number for a specified antenna.
member.param: Name of antenna (e.g.: "0".) If NULL sets all antennas to the same power level.
RF power as percent to maximum power (must be between 0 and 100.)

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IsAntennaConnected(System.String)
member.summary: For an antenna specified by the parameter retrieves it status indicating whether antenna is physically connected to the reader or not.
member.param: String representing Alien antenna name as integer value not greater than MaxAntenna.
member.returns: True if antenna connected, otherwhise false.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.GetAllAntennaStatus
member.summary: Retrieves status of all antennae, indicating which antenna is physically connnected to the reader.
member.returns: Array of TRUE/FALSE values, where index of each element represents antenna name.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.HeartbeatNow
member.summary: Forces the reader to immediately issue a UDP heartbeat, regardless of the HeartbeatTime and HeartbeatCount values.
member.returns: Returns the entire XML-formatted heartbeat packet that was broadcasted.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.G2Wake(System.Int32)
member.summary: Issues single or multiple Gen2 "Select" commands to the field of tags.
member.param: Identifies how many times will be the "Select" command issued.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Service(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: You use the Service command to control auxiliary reader services, such as the serial interface and SNMP.
member.param: Name of the service you wish to control. Valid values: "all", "serial", "snmp", "heartbeat", "ifmon"
Valid values: "status", "start", "stop", "enable", "disable"
member.returns: Reader's response to the command. E.g.: "R A 05 serial" means that Serial service is currently Running, Autostart enabled, startup priority 5)

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.G2Read(nsAlienRFID2.eG2Bank,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs a low-level memory read action on a single Class1 Gen2.
member.param: Gen2 memory bank.
String representing decimal position of first word to read.
String representing decimal number of words ot read. If "0" entire memory bank will be read.
member.returns: Hexadecimal string with read bytes.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.G2Write(nsAlienRFID2.eG2Bank,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs a low-level memory write action to a single Class1 Gen2 tag.
member.param: Gen2 memory bank: 0-Kill/Access passwords, 1-EPC, 2-Tag Identifier, 3-User data.
Position of first word to read.
Hexadecimal string representing even number of bytes to write.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgramAlienImage(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the entire Gen2 tag's memory map.
member.param: Hexadecimal string (with separate bytes) representing a sequence of 24 bytes containing the complete tag memory image. If NULL or empty string, the reader will use data predefined by the ProgramAlienImageMap and other relavant properties (e.g.: PrgEPCData, ProgUserData, etc.)

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.GetStatistics
member.summary: EXPERIMENTAL (may change)! Retrieves statistics information for current reader and its antennas accumulated since reader's bootup.
member.returns: List, where each list item represents tag-related statistic information for a separate antenna or the entire device.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.GetStatistics(System.String)
member.summary: EXPERIMENTAL (may change)! Actually retrieves from the reader statistics information related to tag operations for specified antenna.
member.param: Must be an Alien antenna name (e.g.: "0", "1", etc.)
member.returns: AlienStatistics object with all field set (including the antenna name.)

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.BlinkLED(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Causes the reader to cycle LED status lights between specified two states for specified duration and number of times.
member.param: Decimal bitmask for first LED state. Valid values: 0...255.
Decimal bitmask for second LED state. Valid values: 0...255.
Duration in milliseconds to hold each output state. Valid values: 10...2500.
Number of times to cycle through the two states. Valid values: 0...255.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.GetCurrentMessages(System.String[]@)
member.summary: Retrieves an array of currently collected messages in case when nobody has subscribed to the MessageReceived event. This method is suetable for applications developed in a synchronous model (e.g.: Visual Basic 6.) Instead of complex management of events raised on a thread different from main GUI thread, these applicationcan can just periodically call this method synchronously.
member.param: Array of strings currently not yet delivered to a subscriber. The maximum number of Messages has been defined by the MaxMessagesCount property.
member.returns: Number of messages in the array.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ClearCurrentMessages
member.summary: Clears the internal collection of asynchronous messages. This method doesn't apply to the Upgrade Messages.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.GetCurrentUpgradeMessages(nsAlienRFID2.IAlienUpgradeInfo[]@)
member.summary: Retrieves an array of currently collected objects for progress of a running reader's upgrade in case when nobody has subscribed to the UpgradeProgress and UpgradeComplete events. This method is suetable for applications developed in a synchronous model (e.g.: Visual Basic 6.) Instead of complex management of events raised on a thread different from main GUI thread, these applicationcan can just periodically call this method synchronously. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.
member.param: Array of objects of type UpgradeInfo currently not yet delivered to any subscriber. The maximum number of objects in the retrieved array has been defined by the MaxUpgradeMessagesCount property.
member.returns: Number of objects in the array.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ClearCurrentUpgradeMessages
member.summary: Clears the internal collection of asynchronous upgrade messages. This method applys only to the messages generated during reader's upgrade and doesn't affect any other general reader's messages. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.UpgradeFirmware(System.String)
member.summary: Initiates upgrading reader's firmware with the specified firmware file. Result has been reported by UpgradeComplete and UpgradeProgress events. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.
member.param: Full path and name of the firmware file.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.CancelUpgrade
member.summary: Cancels upgrading reader's firmware performed initiated by the UpgradeFirmware() method. Raises the UpgradeComplete event with the Cancelled property of the UpgradeInfo object set to true. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.DataReceived
member.summary: Raised when an Alien Reader object receives a line of data (usually terminated by the line-terminator: "\r\n") from reader.
member.remarks: Raised on an AsyncCallBack thread.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.MessageReceived
member.summary: Raised when an Alien Reader object receives a complete message terminated by the "\0" from reader.
member.remarks: Raised on an AsyncCallBack thread.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Connected
member.summary: Raised when an Alien Reader object has successfully connected to a TCP client socket or opened an existing serial port.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Disconnected
member.summary: Raised when an Alien Reader object disconnected from TCP client socket or closed an opened previously serial port.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.UpgradeProgress
member.summary: Event raised during the reader's firmware upgrade initiated by the UpgradeFirmware() method. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.UpgradeComplete
member.summary: Event raised after completion of the reader's firmware upgrade initiated by the UpgradeFirmware() method. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AlienChannelDown
member.summary: Raised when Alien Notifications from reader can not reach a host listener on network.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Function
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing Alien reader state (function.) Not all reader properties and commands are available all the time. This depends on the current reader state (function). The Function property is used for managing the availability of commands and other properties and helps to prevent damage or misuse of readers and tags. Valid values are: "Reader", "Programmer".
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

example.code: mReader.Function = "Programmer";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Info
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets a multiple-line list of current reader's settings.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.UserName
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets current user name (default = "alien") Note: The value of user name has been used for network connection to the reader
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Password
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets current password.
If reader is not connected throws an exception. Note: The value of password has been used for network connection to the reader.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Antenna
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing decimal number of current antenna that reader uses for programming (ProgAntenna.)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.MaxAntenna
member.summary:
CLI Property. Read-only property that returns the number of the maximum addressable antenna port of the reader. Antenna ports are numbered starting at zero, so the actual number of ports is one more than the MaxAntenna value.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AntennaSequence
member.summary:
CLI Property. Sets / Gets string containing comma-separated antenna numbers that the reader cycles through as it performs reads. Alien Reader has variable number of antennae that are numbered starting 0.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgAntenna
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing decimal number of current antenna that reader uses for programming (ProgAntenna.)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.DHCP
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string describing status of the DHCP as "ON" or "OFF".
If reader is not connected throws an exception. Reader rebooting is required for changes to take place.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IPAddress
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets the current IP address from / to the connected reader. If the reader is not connected, throws an exception. Reader rebooting is required for changes to take place.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Gateway
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets gateway server IP address string for manual configuration the reader on the network.
If reader is not connected throws an exception. Reader rebooting is required for changes to take place.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Netmask
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets Netmask value as string for manual network configuration of the reader
If reader is not connected throws an exception. Reader rebooting is required for changes to take place.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.DNS
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets DNS as a string for manual reader configuration on the network.
If reader is not connected throws an exception. Reader rebooting is required for changes to take place.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.MACAddress
member.summary:
CLI Property. Read-only property that returns string representing the readers MACAddress value as a part of network configuration. A Media Access Control Address uniquely identifies each device with a network interface.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing decimal value of the current port number used for TCP network communication.

CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing IP Address for automated upgrading.

member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string identifying if the network upgrade is On or Off.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.HeartbeatPort
member.summary:

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TimeServer
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string containing IP address of an Internet time server for adjusting reader's internal clock every time it is rebooted. Default value is "132.163.4.101" (a primary NIST network time server.)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TimeZone
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing decimal value of the current time zone for automatic adjusting the reader's internal clock with an Internet Time server.

member.summary:
