member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ExternalInput
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets a string representing decimal value of the bit mask settings of the external Input pins.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.InitExternalOutput
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets integer in decimal format that is a bit map of the value used to set the external output state during the reader's startup. Bit 0 represents the state of pin 0, bit 1 represents the state of pin 1, etc.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.InvertExternalInput
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets On-Off string representing reader's property that provides / defines whether the External Input pin values are inverted (pin value of 1 corresponds to the low pin voltage and vice versa.)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.InvertExternalOutput
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets On-Off string representing reader's property that provides / defines whether the External Output pin values are inverted (pin value of 1 corresponds to the low pin voltage and vice versa.)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagList
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets internal reader's tag list as multi-line string.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagListCustomFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representation of the custom tag list format.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagListAntennaCombine
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string value representing if the count parameter for a tag in the Tag list calculated for all antennae. Valid values: "ON" or "OFF".
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoMode
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing Auto mode state ("ON" or "OFF")
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoWaitOutput
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing the output pin settings to effect while in the Wait-state of Auto mode. Valid values -1 to 255. For example: AutoWaitOutput = "3"; //Turn pins 0 and 1 to high
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoStartTrigger
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing the external input pins to monitor to cause the Auto mode to jump from the wait-state to workp-state. For example: AutoStartTrigger = "3, 0"; // Listen fro rising edges on pins 0 and 1
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoWorkOutput
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing the output pin settings to effect while in the work-state of Auto mode. Valid values -1 to 255. For example: AutoWorkOutput = "3"; // Turn pins 0 and 1 to high
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoAction
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing the action to perform when running in the work-state of the Auto mode ("Acquire" (default), "Program", "Erase", "Program and Lock", "Kill", "ProgramUse", "ProgramAndLockUser", "ProgramAlienImage")
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoStopTrigger
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing the external input pins to monitor to cause the Auto mode to jump from work-state to evaluate-state. For example: AutoStopTrigger = "3, 0"; // rising edges on pins 0 and 1
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoStopTimer
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing the time period (in milliseconds) used for time-based jump from work-state to evaluate-state. For example: AutoStopTimer = "1000"; //Acquire for 1 sec then evaluate
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoTruePause
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing a milliseconds pause to effect after AutoTrueOutput command if the Evaluation-mode evaluates to true.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoTrueOutput
member.summary:
CLI Property. Specifies the output pin settings to effect if the Evaluation-mode of Auto mode evaluates to true. Valid values -1 to 255. For example: AutoTrueOutput = "3"; //Turn pins 0 and 1 to high
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoFalsePause
member.summary:
CLI Property. Specifies string representing a millisecond pause to effect if the Autonomous Evaluation mode evaluates to false.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoFalseOutput
member.summary:
CLI Property. Specifies string representing the output pin settings to effect if the Evaluation mode of Auto mode evaluates to false. Valid values -1 to 255. For example: AutoFalseOutput = "3"; // Turn pins 0 and 1 to high
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoModeStatus
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets string representing an integer (in decimal format) that specifies current state of the Auto mode state machine. ("0" - OFF, "10" - Initializing, "20" - listening for a start trigger, "30" - starting its action, "40" - processing Action, "50" - listening for Stop condition, "60" - entering Evaluation stage, "70" - 'true' or 'false' pause stage, "80" - notify stage)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyMode
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets String specifying current Notify mode ("ON" or "OFF".)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

example.code: mReader.NotifyMode = "OFF";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing current Notify format ("Text", "XML", "Custom")
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyTime
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing time interval (in seconds) for sending out Notification messages. (Default = "30".)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyHeader
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets On-Off string representing reader's property that provides / defines whether the notification messages contain all fields or the tag list only.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

example.code: mReader.NotifyHeader = "OFF";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyAddress
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string specifying where Notification messages should be sent to.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

example.code: mReader.NotifyAddress = "serial"; // OR
mReader.NotifyAddress = "user@msn.com"; // OR
mReader.NotifyAddress = "10.1.0.12:4000";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyTrigger
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing the event conditions other than time-based for sending Notification messages.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

example.code: mReader.NotifyTrigger = "Remove"; // Send message when a tag is removed from the Tag list.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyKeepAliveTime
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing time period (in seconds) that the reader will keep the TCP socket open after sending a notification messages. Default is 30. Value ranges from 1 to 32767.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

example.code: mReader.NotifyKeepAliveTime = "90";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyRetryCount
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets number of times the reader will try to send a notifycation before giving up and turning Off NotifyMode.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyRetryPause
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets number of seconds for reader to wait between sequential attempts to sent a notification successfully.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.MailServer
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing an SMTP mail server for sending Notification over e-Mail.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.MailFrom
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing sender address in the Notifications sent via e-Mail.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgramPassCode
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing the pass-code used by the Lock command for automatic programming.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgramID
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets Hexadecimal string of a tag ID to program (for automatic programming.)
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgIncrementOnFail
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets the On-Off string defining if the reader will increment the ProgramID after an unsuccess programming.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgSuccessFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets integer value indicating which string the reader returns on successful programming: if ProgSuccessFormat = 0 - reader returns "Success!", if 1 - reader returns programmed ID.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.HeartbeatCount
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets integer value indicating the total number of heartbeats to send out after rebooting.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.
member.value: * Default value is -1 (reader sends heartbeats continuously all the time. * Value 0 is for not sending any heartbeat. * Valid values are up to 65535.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoStartPause
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets number of milliseconds to wait after receiving a start trigger before starting the AutoMode.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoStopPause
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets number of milliseconds to wait after receiving a stop trigger before starting the AutoMode. This delay apply only when IO trigger stops the reader and not when the AutoAction is stopped because of the AutoStopTimer expiring. Default value is 0 (no delay.)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.RFLevel
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets an integer number representing reader's RF output power in dB/10. This property is complementary to the RFAttenuation. It is calculated by the following formula "RFLevel = MaxPower - FRAttenuation." Default value equals MaxPower (316.)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.RFModulation
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets string value that specifies modulation mode for the Gen2 protocol. Valid values: "25FMO" (same as "STD" for Standard) , "06FMO" (same as "HS"" for High Speed), "25M4"(default, same as "DRM" for Dense Reader Mode), "12M4", or "06M4".

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.LBT
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets "On/Off" value specifying state of the Alien Listen-Before-Talk feature that has been used with AutoMode. Alien LBT functionality is NOT the same as the one used in the ETSI context. In opposite to the ETSI LBT, the Alien LBT is a "wide band" measurement of all the RF energy across the frequency band 902-928 MHz, it is a fast measurement (~1msec), and requires no special hardware. Default value is "Off."

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.LBTvalue
member.summary: CLI Property. Read-only property representing value of current RF energy detected.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.LBTlimit
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets integer representing threshold value for LBT operation in AutoMode. Valid values are 0 to 4095. Defaul value is 1000.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagListMillis
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets "On/Off" value specifying whether the millisecond resolution has been enabled in tag reads timestamp. Default value is "Off."

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgProtocol
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets integer value representing the tag protocol for subsequent programming operations. Valid values: 0 for Class0, 1 for Class1 (both 64- and 96-bit tags), and 2 (default) for Class1 Gen2.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.HostName
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets current reader's host name on the network. May be overriden by DHCP server. The HostName must be between 1 and 15 characters in length. Default is "alien-xxyyzz", where xx, yy, and zz are the last three bytes of the reader's MAC address. Changes to the HostName take effect immediately.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgEPCData
member.summary: CLI Property. This Get/Set property (same as 'ProgramID') stores an EPC ID value for use with subsequent 'ProgramEPC' methods when the latter has an empty string or null parameter. This data is also used when AutoMode is running with the AutoAction set to "ProgramEPC" or "ProgramAndLockEPC." For Class1 tags this property is identical to the 'ProgramID' Hexadecimal string includes space-separated list of bytes. E.g.: "80 00 01 02 03 04 05 06 07 08 09 0A"

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgUserData
member.summary: CLI Property. This Get/Set property stores user data for use with subsequent 'ProgramUser' methods, when the latter has an empty string or null parameter. Some Gen2 tags may not support USER memory and the amount of data allowed in the USER memory bank may varie also. Hexadecimal string includes space-separated list of bytes. E.g.: "DE AD BE EF CA FE"

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgEPCDataInc
member.summary: CLI Property. Get/Set property that specifies when and if reader automatically increments the 'ProgEPCData' value after programming an EPC ID. The valid values are (case-insencitive): "OFF", "Success", "Fail", "Always."

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgUserDataInc
member.summary: CLI Property. Get/Set property that specifies when and if reader automatically increments the 'ProgUserData' value after programming Gen2 tags USER bank. Valid values are (case-insencitive): "OFF", "Success", "Fail", "Always."

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgG2LockType
member.summary: CLI Property. Get/Set property that stores the type of a lock to be performed in subsequent Gen2 lock operations. The EPC, Kill Password, Access Password, and User data (where supported) can all be locked with different lock types. Valid values are (case-insencitive): "Lock", "PermaLock", "PermaUnlock."

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgC1KillPwd
member.summary: CLI Property. This Get/Set property (same as the 'ProgramPassCode') stores the necessary data when none is included in the 'Lock' or 'ProgramKillPwd' methods. This data is also used in when AutoMode is running with the AutoAction set to 'ProgramAndLockEPC' when using C1 tags. Class1 Gen1 tags take a single byte for a Kill Password.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgG2KillPwd
member.summary: CLI Property. This Get/Set property stores the necessary data when none is uncluded in the 'PrograKillPwd' method. Gen2 tags take four bytes for a Kill Password. Not all Gen2 tags support a Kill Password.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgG2AccessPwd
member.summary: CLI Property. This Get/Set property stores the necessary data when none is included in the 'ProgramAccessPwd' method. Gen2 tags take four bytes for an Access Password. Not all Gen2 tags support an Access Password.
member.remarks: NOTE: This property DOES NOT store the value that is used by the reader to gain access to a password-protected tag. Use the 'AcqG2AccessPwd' property instead.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AcqG2AccessPwd
member.summary: CLI Property. This Get/Set property stores the necessary Access Password that is required by the tag in the "secure" state, which allows lock/unlock operations. If a tag has a non-zero Access Password, the reader must provide the same password value to enable locking/unlocking. Reader then uses this value automatically in every lock/unlock operation.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagStreamMode
member.summary: CLI Property. Get/Set property that turns on/off tag streaming, which is the quickest way of receiving tag data. This feature does NOT affect the existing taglist buffering functions in the reader. Valid values are (case insencitive): "ON", "Off."

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOStreamMode
member.summary: Get/Set property that turns on/off reader's Digital IO streaming. Valid values are (case insencitive): "ON", "Off."

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagStreamAddress
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets string specifying where reader sends its TagStream event messages to.

example.code: mReader.TagStreamAddress = "serial";
mReader.TagStreamAddress = "10.1.0.12:4000";
mReader.TagStreamAddress = "user@msn.com";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOStreamAddress
member.summary: CLI Property. Gets / Sets string specifying where reader sends its IOStream event messages to.

example.code: mReader.IOStreamAddress = "serial";
mReader.IOStreamAddress = "10.1.0.12:4000";
mReader.IOStreamAddress = "user@msn.com";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagStreamFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing current TagStream format ("Text", "XML", "Terse", "Custom")
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOStreamFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing current IOStream format ("Text", "XML", "Terse", "Custom")
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagStreamKeepAliveTime
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing time period (in seconds) that the reader will keep the TCP socket open after sending a TagStream messages. Default is 30. Value ranges from 1 to 32767.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

example.code: mReader.TagStreamKeepAliveTime = "90";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOStreamKeepAliveTime
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing time period (in seconds) that the reader will keep the TCP socket open after sending an IOStream messages. Default is 30. Value ranges from 1 to 32767.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

example.code: mReader.IOStreamKeepAliveTime = "90";

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TagStreamCustomFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string which specifies the exact formatting of data in TagStream messages.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOStreamCustomFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string which specifies the exact formatting of data in IOStream messages.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOType
member.summary:
CLI Property. Specifies which IO events to track and report:
eIOType.DI - inputs only
eIOType.DO - outputs only
eIOType.DIO - inputs and outputs, interleaved by event time
eIOType.DIDO - inputs followed by outputs (not interleaved)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOListFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string representing current IOList format ("Text", "XML", "Terse", "Custom")
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOListCustomFormat
member.summary:
CLI Property. Gets / Sets string which specifies the exact formatting of data in an IOList message.
If reader is not connected throws an exception.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyInclude
member.summary:
CLI Property. Specifies which fields are included into notification messages along with (or instead of) tag list:
eNotifyInclude.Tags - TagList only
eNotifyInclude.All - TagList and IOList
eNotifyInclude.DIO - IOList only (inputs and outputs)
eNotifyInclude.DI - inputs from IOList only
eNotifyInclude.DO - outputs from IOList only

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.NotifyQueueLimit
member.summary: CLI Property. This property allows spedifying how many failed notification mesasges the reader can queue for later delivery. (Once this limit is reached, older messages will be dropped in favor of newer messages.)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IOList
member.summary: CLI Property. Read-only property which returns (and clears) current IOList.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.DSPVersion
member.summary: Returns string with the version of DSP bits along with the configuration and locality information that may be useful to Alien Support in troubleshooting matters.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ETSIMode
member.summary: The standard ETSI mode that the ALR-8800 reader operates under is the EN 302 208 standard. The ALR-8800 can be directed to meet the requirements of the EN 300 220 standard with the ETSIMode command. The reader should be rebooted in order for changes to the ETSIMode to take full effect. After the ETSIMode is changed, the ReaderType reflects the new regulatory standard as well. Valid values: "302.208"(default) and "300.220"

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.DHCPTimeout
member.summary: Gets / Sets maximum amount of time (in seconds) for reader to wait an IP Address assigned by DHCP. Default value is 30 seconds. Reader rebooting is required for changes to take place.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.WWWPort
member.summary: The reader's web server normally listens on port 80 (default) for incoming connections (the default www port). The WWWPort can be changed to any allowed port number, although care must be taken not to use port number that is commonly used for other services, such as telnet, NTP, SNMP, etc. Valid values: 0...65535. Value 0 will disable the reader's web server and can affect firmware upgrade abilities. Change takes place immediately.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.HostLog
member.summary: The HostLog dumps a log of all the host activity (connects, disconnects, timeouts, etc.) This can be used to figure out when connections were made to the reader, whether serial or TCP, and the IP address of the connecting host (if TCP). HostLog data is reset each time the reader boots and will periodically be rotated out causing older log entries to be lost.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.DebugHost
member.summary: ON/OFF value indicating whether reader should log each and every command that is issued to the reader. The list of commands is viewed with the HostLog command.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgAlienImageMap
member.summary: String that specifies how a Class1 Gen2 tag will be programmed when a subsequent ProgramAlienImage command will be issued. Valid values: "Higgs2_96" (same as "EPC96"), "Higgs2_128" (same as "EPC128"), "Higgs2_96U64 (same as "EPC96USER64"), "Higgs3", Higgs3_96".

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgAlienImageNSI
member.summary: Hexadecimal string of space-separated bytes, that specifies how the NSI (Numbering System Identifier) field of a Class1 Gen2 tag will be programmed when a subsequent ProgramAlienImage command will be issued. Valid values: Hexadecimal string with a contents of NSI field.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AcqG2TagData
member.summary: String specifying which parts of tag memory to read. Up to 4 parts (separated by '|' character) could be specified. Valid values: "0" for none or decimal numbers in following format for each part: [Bank], [WordPtr], [WordCnt] Example: AcqG2TagData = "1,1,2 | 3,0,2"

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.SpeedFilter
member.summary:
Allows to get only those tags that have particular velocity, measured in m/s.
E.g.: SpeedFilter = -1.5, 1.5 allows to read only tags with velocity between these value; SpeedFilter = 1.5, -1.5 makes visible only tags that move faster or slower than indicated values.
In case of multiple ranges (up to 4) separated by the '|' character tag will be reported if it fits at least one of them.
Use default value of "0" to not to use SpeedFilter.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.RSSIFilter
member.summary:
Allows to get only those tags that have particular signal strength.
E.g.: RSSIFilter = 0, 35000 allows to read only tags with RSSI between these value; RSSIFilter = 35000, 5000 makes visible only tags with RSSI lower or higher than indicated values.
In case of multiple ranges (up to 4) separated by the '|' character tag will be reported if it fits at least one of them.
Use default value of "0" to not to use RSSIFilter.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AcqG2AntennaCombine
member.summary: ON/OFF value specifying how the reader "wakes" tags during inventory. The default "ON" value forces a single "select" command on all enabled antennas at once. The "OFF" value causes separate "select" command on each used antenna.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AcqG2Target
P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.MyData
member.summary: This reader property is a 254-character scratchpad to store arbitrary data. NOTE: "MyData" has been used by the Alien Provider for BizTalk RFID for storing some properties: e.g. "Event Mode" etc.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ProgDataUnit
member.summary: String specifying which programming method to use for all Gen2 writing operations: "word-by-word" or "block-by-block." Valid values: "Word" (default) or "Block". NOTE: If you set the ProgDataUnit = "Block" and a tag doesn't support "block-writing", all subsequent programming operations on this tag will fail.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoModeType
member.summary: String specifying which auto mode type is used when there are no tags in the field. Valid values: Standard" (default) or "Seek" for reducing RF power (resulting in low RF interferece) when there are no tags.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoSeekTimer
member.summary: Specifies the interval in milliseconds to continue looking for tags (even none are present) before entering the sniffing mode. This property is used only if the AutoModeType is "Seek." Valid values: "0"..."86400000." Default is "500"

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoSeekPause
member.summary: Specifies the interval in milliseconds to pause between sniffs. This property is used only if the AutoModeType is "Seek." Valid values: "0"..."86400000." Default is "250"

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AutoSeekRFLevel
member.summary: Specifies the RF power level to use while in sniffing mode. This property is used only if the AutoModeType is "Seek." Valid values are between min and max power for each specific reader model. Default is maximum power (e.g.: "316" for ALR-9800 readers.)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.Logging
member.summary: Value of TRUE allows (FALSE disallows) writing all reader communications to the AlienAPI.log file. New value propagates to transport objects on next connection to reader. This property works in the same way as boolean parameter in constructor's overloads, but makes this functionality available for COM users as well.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ReaderSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets current reader settings in the API in the format of type ReaderInfo.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IsListening
member.summary: Gets boolean value indicating whether the internal library's client socket is currently listening for an asynchronous response from the reader.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets boolean value representing whether the clsReader object has established serial or network connection with an Alien reader.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ReaderState
member.summary: Returns a Hashtable with the current reader's state. The reader state has been described by the response to the Alien command "i" ("Info".)

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ReaderStateMonitoring
member.summary:
Gets / Sets boolean value indicating if the reader object monitors information about the current reader state. If True enables periodical (with the ReaderStateUpdateInterval) monitoring current reader's state by issuing the "Info" command to the reader and storing it in the ReaderState object.
Default value false.
member.remarks: If there is no reader connection, than reader state monitoring is unavailable and this property will be set to 'false' automatically by the updating routine.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ReaderStateUpdateInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets time intervals in seconds for pulling the current information about the reader state by issuing the "Info" command. Used only if the ReaderStateMonitoring property is set to true.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.TimeWaitWhenBusy
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds between checks of the availability of the SendReceive() method. Default 100 milliseconds.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.RetriesWhenBusy
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times to check for availability of the SendReceive() method before throwing the "Busy" exception. Default 10 times.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ComTimeOutInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for completion of a synchronous operation on Serial port or Telnet. Default = Min = 60000. Max = 2147483647.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ConnectionTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds to wait for completion of TCP connection. The Open() method will return only after this waiting time. This waiting period prevents talking to a socket before its background thread completes connection. If 0, object supposed to talk to socket immediately. If the socket is not able yet to communicate, you may want to adjust this value for your needs. Default value = 0.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.SerialPort
member.summary: Gets or sets string value representing current com port name for communicating with the reader using RS-232. Valid values: "COM1:", "COM2:", ..., "COM9:"

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.QuitOnSocketFailure
member.summary: Read-write property defining if the ethernet connection to the reader should be terminated on a TCP-socket failure.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ForceUpdates
member.summary:
Read-write property defining if the API will execute the requested setting and getting some of reader's properties.
If set to true, when retrieving or changing for example the AntennaSequence value during the AutoMode set ON, the API will first turn the AutoMode OFF, change the AntennaSequence property value, and then set the AutoMode back ON.
If true, this property also turns off the DHCP automaticaly for all requests to set some network related properties, for example, an IP Address.
If set to false then, for example,the AntennaSequence could not be retieved or changed during the AutoMode; the IP Address could not be set with DHCP on. An attempt to do so will cause an exception with "Error27".

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.SerialBaudRate
member.summary:
Gets or sets the baud rate for serial communicaiton on both reader and host. Reader has to be connected.
When setting new baud rate, this property first changes the ReaderBaudRate, then SAVES ALL CURRENT SETTINGS to the reader, reboots it, and reconnects using new baud rate value affecting the 'HostBaudRate' and the 'ReaderBaudRate' properties.
If reader's and host's baudrates are different, this property returns string containing both values separated by comma starting from reader's baud rate. Valid values:
"115200" (default)
"57600"
"38400"
"19200"
"9600"
NOTE: setting this property may take up to 30 seconds. For getting/setting host's baud rate see: . For getting/setting reader's baud rate see:

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.HostBaudRate
member.summary:
Gets or sets the baud rate on HOST to match reader's baud rate. Changing this property with a connected reader will throw an exception. For getting/setting reader's baud rate value see 'ReaderBaudRate' property. Valid values:
115200 (default)
57600
38400
19200
9600

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.ReaderBaudRate
member.summary:
Gets or sets the serial communication baud rate on the READER. The response and serial communication continues on the old baud rate. For new baud rate value to take effect on the reader a separate "Save" command and rebooting are required (not performed by this property.) Valid values:
115200 (default)
57600
38400
19200
9600

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.KeepNetworkConnectionAlive
member.summary: Read-write property specifying if the TCP connection to reader that has been open as a Command channel should be kept alive. If this property has been set to 'true', the API periodically sends to reader the "\r\n" alerting messages. The time period for this alert messages depends on value of the 'NetworkTimeout' property. This keeps reader's TCP socket open and thus prevents network connection with the reader from timing out.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.MaxMessagesCount
member.summary: Gets / Sets maximum number of messages that can be stored while there are no subscribers to the MessageReceived event. Default value is 1000. When this limit has been reached the oldest message will be automatically removed before adding a new one.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.MaxUpgradeMessagesCount
member.summary: Gets / Sets maximum number of upgrade messages that can be stored while there are no subscribers to the UpgradeProgress and the UpgradeComplete events. Default value is 1000. When this limit has been reached the oldest message will be automatically removed before adding a new one. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.IsUpgrading
member.summary: TRUE while instance is running a reader firmware upgrade routine. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.UpgradeProgressEventHandler
member.summary: Event Handler for UpgradeProgress event faired during the reader's firmware upgrade. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.UpgradeCompleteEventHandler
member.summary: Event Handler for UpgradeComplete event faired when the reader's firmware upgrade has been finished or cancelled. NOT available in the Alien Mobile API.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReader.AlienChannelDownEventHandler
member.summary: Alien Notifications from reader can not reach a host server on network. NOTE: Reader must be connected on serial channel for receiving these warning messages and raising these events.
member.param: Message from reader received on open serial channel.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor
member.summary: Defines methods, properties, and events for monitoring of Alien readers.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor of the clsReaderMonitor class. Prepares objects and threads required for listening for the Alien reader's heartbeats over the network.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor of the clsReaderMonitor class. Prepares objects and threads required for listening for the Alien reader's heartbeats over the network.
member.param: If true and the assembly has been built with Debug configuration AlienAPI*.log files get written logging all reader's communications.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.Dispose
member.summary: Stops listening over the Alien readers heartbeats and disposes objects.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ClearAllReaders
member.summary: Clears current reader list for both network and Com ports.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ClearNetworkReaders
member.summary: Clears current reader list on network.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ClearSerialReaders
member.summary: Clears current reader list on Com ports.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.GetReaderList(nsAlienRFID2.IReaderInfo[]@)
member.summary: Obtains list of readers currently monitored on both network and Com ports.
member.param: 'Out' parameter returns an array of of variables of type ReaderInfo.
member.returns: String "Empty" if there are no readers currently in the reader list, or "".

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.GetReaderListOnSerial(nsAlienRFID2.IReaderInfo[]@)
member.summary: Obtains list of readers currently monitored on Com ports.
member.param: 'Out' parameter returns an array of of variables of type ReaderInfo.
member.returns: Number of elements in the returned array.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.GetReaderListOnNetwork(nsAlienRFID2.IReaderInfo[]@)
member.summary: Obtains list of readers currently monitored on network.
member.param: 'Out' parameter returns an array of of variables of type ReaderInfo.
member.returns: Number of elements in the returned array.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.StartListening
member.summary: Starts monitoring Alien readers on network or Com ports or both depending on values of the ComPortsMonitoring and NetworkMonitoring properties. This method throws exceptions.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.StopListening
member.summary: Stops monitoring Alien readers on both network and Com ports.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.CheckComPorts
member.summary: Checks active Com ports for presense of an Alien reader. Closes every opened connection upon completion. Updates Reader list. Raises events ReaderAdded, ReaderRemoved, ReaderRenewed as well as ReaderAddedOnSerial, ReaderRemovedOnSerial, ReaderRenewedOnSerial.
member.returns: "No reader found", or an empty string on success.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderAdded
member.summary: Occurs when a new reader has been added to the Reader List either by listening to readers' heartbeats over the network or by checking Com ports.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderRemoved
member.summary: Occurs when a known reader has been removed from the Reader List either by absense of its heartbeat in its heartbeat time, or by not finding it on a Com port.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderRenewed
member.summary: Occurs periodically (over the UpdateInterval) when readers that had been already included in the Reader List found alive either by their heartbeat or by checking Com ports.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderListUpdated
member.summary: Occurs every time the Reader List has been updated either because of the UpdateInterval time has been elapsed or because the CheckComPorts() function found a problem or a lost reader.
member.remarks: This event is raised on a Thread Pool thread if the "SynchronizingObject" property is not set.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderAddedOnSerial
member.summary: Occurs when a new reader has been found on a serial port and added to the Reader List.
member.remarks: This event is raised either on the thread of caller to the "CheckComPorts()" method OR on a Thread Pool thread if the "ComPortsMonitoring == true" and the "SynchronizingObject" property is not set.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderAddedOnNetwork
member.summary: Occurs when a new reader has been found and added to the Reader List by listening to readers' heartbeats over network.
member.remarks: This event is raised on a Thread Pool thread if the "SynchronizingObject" property is not set.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderRemovedOnSerial
member.summary: Occurs when a known reader has been removed from the Reader List during monitoring readers on serial ports (ComPortMonitoring == true).
member.remarks: This event is raised either on the thread of caller to the "CheckComPorts()" method OR on a Thread Pool thread if the "ComPortsMonitoring == true" and the "SynchronizingObject" property is not set.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderRemovedOnNetwork
member.summary: Occurs when a known reader has been removed from the Reader List during monitoring readers over network (NetworkMonitoring == true).
member.remarks: This event is raised on a Thread Pool thread if the "SynchronizingObject" property is not set.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderRenewedOnSerial
member.summary: Occurs when a reader that had been already included in the Reader List found alive by monitoring over serial ports (ComPortMonitoring == true).
member.remarks: This event is raised either on the thread of caller to the "CheckComPorts()" method OR on a Thread Pool thread if the "ComPortsMonitoring == true" and the "SynchronizingObject" property is not set.

member.name: E:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderRenewedOnNetwork
member.summary: Occurs when a reader that had been already included in the Reader List found alive by monitoring over network (NetworkMonitoring == true).
member.remarks: This event is raised on a Thread Pool thread if the "SynchronizingObject" property is not set.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets integer value of the network port used for the listening for the Alien readers heartbeats. Settable only when listening stopped or not started. Default value is 3988.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.UpdateInterval
member.summary: Sets or gets an integer value in milliseconds determining how often the library internal Reader List gets updated when listening over the network for the Alien readers heartbeats as well as automatic checking the Com Ports. Defaul value is 1000 msec.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.NetworkMonitoring
member.summary: Gets or sets boolean flag indicating whether to monitor the Network on the timely basis. If true, the clsReaderMonitor object will monitor network for presense of Alien readers by listening to their heartbeats sent using UDP. Default value is true.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ComPortsMonitoring
member.summary: Gets or sets boolean flag indicating whether to monitor the Com ports on the timely basis. If true, the clsReaderMonitor object will monitor presense of Alien readers on Com ports periodically calling method CheckComPorts(). Default value is false.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.IsListening
member.summary: Read-only property reporting if clsReaderMonitor object currently is monitoring readers. True if the StartListening method has been called. False otherwise or if the StopListening has been called.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Get or sets the object used to marshal event-handler that are used when the UpdateInterval has elapsed for monitoring Alien reader. If set to a client application window object, will cause all automatic clsReaderMonitor events raised on the main GUI thread but will partially freeze this window. If null, all automatic clsReaderMonitor events will be raised on ThreadPool threads.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderAddedEventHandler
member.summary: The handler for the ReaderAdded event.
member.param: Variable of type IReaderInfo describing the discovered reader.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderRemovedEventHandler
member.summary: The handler for the ReaderRemoved event.
member.param: Variable of type IReaderInfo describing the reader that has been lost.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderRenewedEventHandler
member.summary: The handler for the ReaderRenewed event.
member.param: Variable of type IReaderInfo describing the reader that has been renewed.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderListUpdatedEventHandler
member.summary: The handler for the ReaderListUpdated event.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderAddedOnSerialEventHandler
member.summary: The handler for the ReaderAddedOnSerial event.
member.param: Variable of type IReaderInfo describing the reader that has been discovered on serial port.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.clsReaderMonitor.ReaderAddedOnNetworkEventHandler

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.CAlienServer
member.summary: Alien Library class that provides a TCP Server Socket for listening for incomming connections and messages from one or more Alien readers.
member.remarks: During asynchronous communication with the reader an object of this class raises events on a Thread Pool thread that should not be used for updating GUI.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CAlienServer.StartListening
member.summary: Starts listening for incomming connection requests and messages. If the server was listening, stops it with loss of all previously established connections and restarts again. Throws exception if there was no IP Address specified previously.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CAlienServer.ParseNotification(System.String,nsAlienRFID2.INotifyInfo@)
member.summary:
Parses an Alien reader Notification string either in the Text or in the XML format into an object of type ReaderInfo and an array of variables of type TagInfo.
Same implementation as in the AlienUtils.ParseNotification() exposed here as a non-static method for COM interface.
member.param: Input string containing Notification data. Must be either in Text or XML format as defined in the Alien Reader Interface Guide. Otherwise an exception will be generated.
'Out' parameter - an object of type NotifyInfo filled with the information available in the Notification message.
member.returns: Number of tags in the Tag list contained within the Notification message.
member.remarks: This method throws exceptions.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CAlienServer.GetCurrentNotifications(nsAlienRFID2.INotifyInfo[]@)
member.summary: Retrieves an array of currently collected Notifications in case when nobody has subscribed to the ServerMessageReceived event. This method is suitable for applications developed in a synchronous model (e.g.: Visual Basic 6.) Instead of complex management of events raised on a thread different from main GUI thread, these applicationcan can just periodically call this method synchronously.
member.param: Array of Notifications currently not yet delivered to a subscriber. The maximum number of Notifications has been defined by the MaxNotifications property.
member.returns: Number of dequeued Notifications.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.CAlienServer.GetCurrentIOEvents(nsAlienRFID2.IAlienIOInfo[]@)
member.summary: Retrieves an array of currently collected IOEvents in case when nobody has subscribed to the ServerMessageReceived event. This method is suitable for applications developed in a synchronous model (e.g.: Visual Basic 6.) Instead of complex management of events raised on a thread different from main GUI thread, these applications can just periodically call this method synchronously.
member.param: Array of IO events currently not yet delivered to a subscriber.
member.returns: Number of dequeued Events.

member.summary: Increments the count for the outstanding operation type. This is implemented such that the IoPacket post routines can make a call to increment the count such that the caller of each post routine doesn't have to make the increment call.

member.summary: Decrements the count for the outstanding operation type. This is implemented such that the IoPacket post routines can make a call to decrement the count such that the caller of each post routine doesn't have to make the decrement call.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.AcceptConnection
member.summary: This class identifies a client connection. It keeps track of all outstanding async send and receive operations and handles completed IO operations.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AcceptConnection.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.Socket,nsAlienRFID2.TcpServer)
member.summary: This is the constructor for the client which takes only the client socket object. It creates the lists of outstanding send and receive operations and posts the initial BeginReceive.
member.param: Socket object representing the client connection
Reference to the server object that owns this client connection

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AcceptConnection.HandleIo(nsAlienRFID2.IoPacket,System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: This overrided routine handles all asynchronous IO that completes on the ClientConnection object. Since the client only sends and receives only the Send and Receive commands are handled. The client connection first receives a request from the client until the client shuts down the send path. At this point the client connection will receive zero bytes indicating the client is done sending. This is followed by the client sending a response to the client. Once the requested number of send operations are performed to the client the client socket is closed and resources are freed (by closing the socket handle and indicating to the owning TcpServer to remove the ClientConnection object from its list of connections).
member.param: IO packet object that describes the completed operation
Asynchronous context information for the completed operation

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.AcceptConnection.RemoveIo(nsAlienRFID2.IoPacket)
member.summary: Removes the given IoPacket from the appropriate ArrayList depending on the operation type.
member.param: IO object to remove from any lists

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.TcpServer
member.summary: This class encapsulates functionality for the TCP server object. This class keeps track of all clients accepted on the listening socket as well as the outstanding asynchronous accept operations. The class keeps track the send and receive byte counters and client counts.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.TcpServer.#ctor(System.Net.IPEndPoint,System.Int32)
member.summary: Simple constructor for the TcpServer class. This initializes the counters and creates the listening TCP socket.

Maximum number of async accepts outstanding

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.TcpServer.RemoveClient(nsAlienRFID2.AcceptConnection)
member.summary: This method removes an accepted client object (AcceptConnection) from the list of accepted connections. It decrements the current client count.
member.param: Accepted client object to remove

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.TcpServer.Shutdown
member.summary: This method marks the TcpServer as shutting down. This flag is set before all the listening sockets are closed.

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.TcpServer.HandleIo(nsAlienRFID2.IoPacket,System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: This routine handles all IO completion events initiated by the TcpServer listening socket which will consist of BeginAccept events. Before accessing the socket, a check is made to make sure the server is not shutting down in which case the listeng socket have already been closed.
member.param: IO packet describing the operation that completed
Asynchronous context information

member.summary: This method removes the IoPacket from the appropriate list.
member.param: The IoPacket to remove from the correct list

member.name: M:nsAlienRFID2.TcpServer.IncrementByteCount(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Increments the sent and received byte counts for all client connections established on this TCP server socket. Each AcceptConnection has a reference to the TcpServer on which the client connection was accepted -- it then calls this method to increment the byte counters.

member.name: T:nsAlienRFID2.AlienBaudRates
member.summary: Helper class that always stores a pair of static integer variables that represent one of values supported by Alien readers. This class provides an easy convertion between common physical baud rate values and their corresponding binary values in both Alien ASCII and Binary Protocols. Currently supported values are: 115200 (default), 57600, 38400, 19200, and 9600 as physical values which correspond to Alien binary parameters: 0 (default), 1, 2, 3, 4. Set properties throw an exception for an attempt to set an unsupported value.

member.name: F:nsAlienRFID2.AlienBaudRates.SupportedValues
member.summary: An array containing set of physical values for supported baud rates.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.AlienBaudRates.PhysicalValue
member.summary: Property representing physical value of current baud rate. Setting a new PhysicalValue affects the corresponding AlienValue stored in this class. Default value is 115200. Can throw an exception if an unsupported value provided to set.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.AlienBaudRates.AlienValue
member.summary: Property representing Alien binary value of current baud rate. Setting a new AlienValue affects the corresponding PhysicalValue stored in this class. Default value is 0. Can throw an exception if an unsupported value provided to set.

member.summary: Provides true/false information about if it is safe to interrupt with running upgrading process and cancel it.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.UpgradeInfo.UploadResult
member.summary: Provides information about status of uploading a firmware file to reader. Value of 0 indicates that firmware file has been uploaded successfully; value of -1 indicates that upload process has been interrupted by a failure and/or cancelled; other error codes possible.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.UpgradeInfo.UpgradeResult
member.summary: Provides information about status of firmware upgrading with an uploaded file. Value of 0 indicates that reader has been upgraded successfully; value of -1 indicates that upgrade process has been interrupted by a failure and/or cancelled; other error codes possible.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.UpgradeInfo.Reconnected
member.summary: Provides true\false information about status of restoring connection after upgrade.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.UpgradeInfo.StateRestored
member.summary: Provides true/false information about status of restoring reader's state after upgrade.

member.name: P:nsAlienRFID2.UpgradeInfo.Cancelled
member.summary: Provides true/false information if upgrade process has been cancelled.

member.summary: Provides true/false information about completion of the upgrade process.
